content: We wrote a client-side Javascript-based validator for the JSON schemas for FHIR (with all the known limitations that entails) - as we’re an end-to-end encrypted platform, we needed to find a solution that didn’t send any validatable data to the server and also doesn't use any eval-y methods. Blog post + open-source https://www.d4l.io/blog/fhir-resource-validation-for-fun-and-nonprofit/ (the npm package is here https://www.npmjs.com/package/@d4l/js-fhir-validator)
